New arXiv review blog coming soon!

Dec 22, 2020

I'm setting up Blo\(g_{\mu\nu}\) to further hone my skills as a peer-review referee, and to draw well-deserved attention to new preprints that I find interesting. The idea is to write a short review of at least one preprint per week, likely drawn from the [gr-qc], [astro-ph] or [hep-th] arXiv.

This will likely start in the new year, as I still need to figure out comments on disqus, and how to handle arXiv trackbacks and RSS so that the authors are properly credited.

The idea for Blo\(g_{\mu\nu}\) is unashamedly stolen from Dr. Sunny Vagnozzi's His Dark CMBlog. Sunny's entire website is absolutely fantastic, and you should explore it before reading any more of my posts.

  • Blo\(g_{\mu\nu}\)

This site is for theoretical, high-energy and gravitational physics and cosmology (broadly defined). More specific topics might include differential geometry, geometric algebra, gauge theories of gravity. Blog-Mu-Nu is a blog which reviews interesting arXiv preprints from [gr-qc], [hep-th] and [astro-ph].
